characters: "GOING OUT OF BUSINESS SALE. EVERYTHING MUST GO. FINAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rabbit hops across rough terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three trucks from Chemical Technologies carry barrels of toxic waste. They pass a sign: PROSPERITY, NEVADA, POP 454.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleepy trucker called PIG PEN drives the third truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be self-assured and confident around women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be self-assured and confident around women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rabbit stops at the edge of the road. The first truck speeds past. Then the second. The rabbit crosses the highway in front of the third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not fear the unexpected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not fear the unexpected. The rabbit appears in the road, frozen by headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhh! Pig Pen jams on his brakes and swerves to avoid the bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck slews crazily.    Missing the bunny by a whiske

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig Pen sees a bridge ahead. If he doesn't regain control, he will crash. At the last second, he gets the rig together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rim of a wheel tags the curb. One of those toxic waste barrels falls out of the back and plunges to the water below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A biohazard warning label is legible as the barrel slips beneath the surface. Glowing toxic waste seeps from a gash in its side. Spreading through the pool like neon ink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ditch is littered with garbage. The DRONE of INSECTS. No visible traces of toxic waste. A butterfly net sweeps through the air to capture an oversized horsefly. JOSHUA TAFT (70s), scrutinizes the bug. This old codger is more comfortable studying bugs than socializing with people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike.   Check this one out. MIKE PALMER (12) steps over for a look.     Puberty hit h and fast for this bright, little nerd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's huge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been like this all week. Must be something extra tasty in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead coyote. Snake maybe. Back in the 'Nam we'd eat python with a dash of habanero sauce. Mighty satisfying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ate snake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're thirty klicks out from the nearest firebase. Humpin' through the wake-up with your finger on the trigger. Charlie doesn't give you time to stop for cutlet. As Mike skims his own net over the water, he glimpses a familiar barrel at the bottom of the pool. The brightly- colored biohazard warning label is clearly visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two bicycles are parked outside a cabin in the middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decor is an odd mix of Vietnam era war relics and homegrown scientist. Charlie the Parrot sits on a perch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, don't surf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, bird.     We're working. Mike and Joshua stand near the spider tanks. A dozen aquariums on low shelves. Each glass tank replicates a specific environment: jungle, desert, cavern, pond, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dims tank lights)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is going down, my nocturnal hunters. It's time to come out and feed. Mike watches Joshua deposit bugs into each spider tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They're definitely getting bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've calculated a growth factor of twelve percent over the last forty-eight hours. But that seems to be accelerating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All from eating these bugs?   Maybe I should try some. Mike pauses at the desert tank, watching a cricket search for food. A trap-door spider pops out of its camouflaged den like a jack-in-the-box. The arachnid yanks the cricket below and replaces the roof in a nanosecond. Mike looks in another tank where ogre-eyed spitting spiders shoot blasts of paralyzing goo at hapless insects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, little guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't outrun the food chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine yourself the size of that fly. A scytodes spitter would be as big as a Cadillac. You'd be spider chow, kid. Mike looks in a tank where jumpers chase fleeing crickets. He moves toward another tank that is covered with a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the new tarantulas in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took me forever to get a breeding set of Chilean reds. I must have bribed every customs agent from Vegas to Santiago. Joshua unveils the    tank. Dirt floor. Several burrow entrances. Joshua     pours in the bugs. A large, male tarantula comes out    of a burrow. It pounces on a bug, then wraps its prey    in webbing, turning the insect int mummy-like bundle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is too cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Male tarantulas compete for the female's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each one tries to bring her the best present. Bugs, rats, even the occasional parrot. CHARLIE SQUAWKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prey is cocooned alive so she can eat them in her nest. You know how women love breakfast in bed. Joshua leads Mike to the back of the tank. A network of subterranean tunnels is revealed. The male tarantulas scuttle through carrying their mummified offerings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look, the female of the species is three times as big as the male. Mike peers into a large den. The female tarantula steps out of the shadows. This is Consuela, the Chilean red tarantula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Consuela. Mike watches Consuela unwrap one of the mummified bundles. She begins to eat the paralyzed insect within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fills her prey with digestive acid to liquify the internal organs. Now watch... She'll drink her victim from the inside out. While it's still alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks queasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you wonder why my mom doesn't like me hanging out with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arachnids have been roaming the earth for millions of years. And they'll be here long after the human race is dead and buried. Suddenly Consuela lunges at the glass.     Mike recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad!   Bad Consuela! Consuela backs up, apparently she can be intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The multi-eyed spider's PANORAMIC VISION. Mike looms large at the edge of the glass, wagging his finger.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO MIKE
dialogues.text: Mike stares into the many eyes of Consuela. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do that again and I feed you to the parrot. CHARLIE SQUAWKS hungrily.    The sound of a CAR HORN. JOSHUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's your mom. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow, Joshua! Mike heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entrance to a mine shaft protrudes from a hillside. A pickup truck is parked nearby. The faded logo on the door reads: McCORMICK AND SON MINING COMPANY, PROSPERITY, NV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rotten beams. Chipped walls. A GENERATOR POWERS a string of lightbulbs. A lone figure works at the end of the tunnel. CHRIS McCORMICK (30s) has rugged good looks. Weathered clothing. Dirt-stained face. Ripped muscles. Chris chips at the wall with his pickaxe. As it makes contact, the occasional spark flies up. Chris pauses to scrutinize the target area with his helmet-light. Something sneaks along the floor of the mine behind him. Chris is oblivious to his unseen stalker. He chips away a section of stone to reveal shiny minerals. Reflections of silver and gold splash across his face. His smile fades...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chris bends over, reaching for a bottle of water. A large rat scurries out of hiding dragging away Chris's sack lunch. Chris grabs his pick-axe and goes after the rat. The rodent dodges every hit. Sparks fly when the axe strikes rock. These ignite a vent of methane gas. A BRIEF EXPLOSION knocks Chris off his feet. He notices a small hole in the floor is lit like the burner on a stove. Chris pats out the flame as the rat scurries away with lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you like bologna!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police car drives with a bicycle hanging out of the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA "SAM" PALMER (30s) is the sheriff of Prosperity and a confident, single mother. Mike is seated beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You   should see them, Mom. Each one   has a unique feeding behavior. The   spitters fire poisonous snot. The   tarantulas mummify their prey. The   jumpers can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he have all those things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies them. NASA uses spider webs in outer space. And for medicine. They've been here forever, and they'll be here long after we're all dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're givin' me nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightmares are cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.P.S. brought this to the station. Sam hands Mike a small package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from Dad! He didn't forget my birthday. I told you he wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better late than never. Mike tears open the box to reveal a Cassiopeia PDA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rockin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the one you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassiopeia 2304 with 64 megs of ram. Integrated modem. Voice recording capability. This baby is tight. Mike can't turn on the gizmo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He forgot to send the batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to send batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of two off-road MOTORCYCLES tearing up the desert. BRET HALE (18) leads the way. A Kid Rock-punk with good looks and FU attitude. Seated behind him is ASHLEY PALMER (16). This milk-fed desert honey is a wannabe Britney Spears. LARRY (17) is the wiseacre on the other bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, babydoll!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They GUN their BIKES onto the highway. Slalom the yellow lines. Wheelie for days. Ashley peeks over Bret's shoulder at a police car coming at them in the opposite lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Sam watches intently as the bikes wheelie past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car does an impressive bootlegger 180. Lights ablaze. SIREN WAILING. The bikes pull over to the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycles stop with the cop car behind.        Sam' voice barks over the PA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party's over, gentlemen.   Off the bikes. Sam exits the car and approaches.       The bikers dismou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something very sexy about an older woman in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her nine-millimeter gives me a stiffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't antagonize her, you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to act like kamikazes. Especially with Ashley riding behind. That is unacceptable, Bret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could always ride her from behind. Larry snickers.     Sam steels her rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just bought yourself a reckless. Sam begins to write up the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you give 'em a break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car, Ashley.       Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mom! Sam shoots his daughter an intimidating glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sweat, babydoll.       We'll hook up later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threatening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over my dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike grins from the front seat as Ashley climbs in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, dork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hands Bret the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, do we know anybody at City Hall who can mark this go away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Dad is the Mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. (to Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signs your paycheck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next time you put my daughter's life in danger, I'll show you exactly how little that means to me. Bret and Larry feel her resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, bee-otch. It's all good. The punks remount their bikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want both wheels on the ground. The punks REV their BIKES and defiantly wheelie toward town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam climbs behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read her her rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can always count on you, Mike. Sam STARTS the CAR and drives toward town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you get off on humiliating me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This bad girl act doesn't suit you, Ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to have fun. Don't you remember what it's like to grow up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what scares me.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sam reaches over and opens the glove box. She pulls out a stun gun. Mike passes it through the bars to Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to keep this with you. Ashley slides the zapper into her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so over protective. Mike and Ashley lip-sync along with Sam's response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mother's job is to protect her children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to start trusting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to. But you keep skipping classes to go to the dunes with Bret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you hate him so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hate him. I just want you to have a future. I thought you wanted to get out of town. Go to med school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I want to stay. I could get pregnant by nineteen. Then divorce with a couple of kids I can't handle. Slap on a badge and be a trailer trash sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the flashback. They drive on in painful silence.     Mike turns ON the RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... listening to W.F.R.E. Freedom radio. We've put aside the U.F.O.'s and conspiracy theories...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris drives into town with the RADIO ON. HARLAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... for some down home talk back with our own mayor: Wade Hale. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Harlan. As I was saying, Chemical Technologies has been looking for viable storage sites. And Prosperity is lucky enough to be on that list. HARLAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky? I think most of us are insulted that some outsiders think our town is a perfect place to dump toxic waste. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris's pickup approaches... The entire town is not much bigger than a few football fields. The kind of place where everybody has known each other since childhood. Some buildings date back to the 1880's gold rush. HARLAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this just your latest get- rich quick scheme? At one end is the Prosperity Mall. A huge windowless rectangle in the sand. Permanent signs tout the many outlet stores inside: Victoria's Secret, Home and Garden Supplies, Sport Chalet, etc. Hand-painted signs reveal:

dialogues.speaker: "GOING OUT OF BUSINESS SALE. EVERYTHING MUST GO. FINAL
dialogues.text: CLOSE OUT." On the roof of the mall is a very tall radio antenna. HARLAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mall has more employees than customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris smiles as he listens to the RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may have overestimated the need for 100,000 square feet of outlet shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEVERLY (40's) is tending to her garden as she listens to a transistor radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your ostrich ranch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the government subsidies hadn't dried up, I'd still be rolling in cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airstream at the far end of town. Signs identify it as: "FREEDOM RADIO." A brand new humvee is parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walls decorated with clippings about aliens, monsters, and conspiracies. Two men sit at a home built transmitter. HARLAN GRIFFITH (40s) wears an "Aliens Go Home!" T- shirt. He eats from a box of Frosted Flakes and drinks Jolt cola. WADE HALE (40s) is the mayor of Prosperity. A slick- haired dandy who looks more like a Vegas lounge singer than a Mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one phone call I could put together a deal that would make us all very rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say money doesn't buy happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They probably don't have any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and her kids listen to the radio. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money pays for kids to go to college. It pays the mortgage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An attractive waitress on roller-skates. A harried CHEF. Locals chow down. The RADIO BLARES in the b.g. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It puts food on the table. Haven't the people of this town lived hand-to-mouth for long enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLOYD and LEROY are the Jurassic era barbers. Floyd cuts Leroy's hair. The two men listen to the RADIO. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all gonna die in this hell hole. FLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of boredom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEPUTY PETE sits with his feet up on the desk reading Playstation magazine. He listens to the RADIO. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it be nice not to worry about surviving retirement? Or taking a shot at that life-long dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it, Harlan, you could buy a commercial transmitter and start broadcasting to a national audience. HARLAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be nice to get the message out. Let people know the aliens walk among us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris slows to a stop in front of the McCormick and Son Mining Company. This stately edifice was once the driving force behind the local economy. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Chris McCormick refuses to sell his mines. The rest of us are out of luck. Chris frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's fair for one person to wield that much power. But he's just like his father. Selfish. Greedy. And more than a little bit nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Sam flips on the SIREN and accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locals stop eating and look toward the radio. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That family has been digging in those tunnels since the twenties. If there was something down there, don't you think they would have found it by now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floyd and Leroy stare at the radio. WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Common sense does not apply to crazy people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might as well be chasing a leprechaun's pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chris is furious as he PEELS OUT and speeds toward Harlan's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locals watch Chris's pickup speed by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... lunatics...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floyd and Leroy watch Chris speed by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... certifiably nuts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sam pulls into town. She sees Chris skid to a stop in front of Harlan's trailer. He leaps out of his pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... at the very least...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris yanks the door open in time to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... those McCormicks are just plain-old dumb. Wade stands up to protest. But it's too late. Chris punches him in the nose. The mayor tumbles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've warned you not to talk about my family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a surprise guest in the studio. Chris drags Wade to his feet, shoving him against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family built this town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to be grateful? Chris draws back his fist for another shot.       Sam run and grabs him from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of this, Sam! She manhandles Chris toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Practically the entire town has gathered outside. Sam drags Chris through the door. Wade and Harlan are close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what he said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him locked up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all calm down. Wade tries to take advantage of the assembled audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no economy! People are barely scraping by! And now we've been offered the deal of a lifetime. You don't have the right to stand in our way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those mines are full of gas. One spark in the wrong place could blow this entire valley sky high. Do you really want to load that gun with toxic waste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chem-Tech did seismic analysis, vapor checks, groundwater reads, soil sampling. They found isolated methane pockets, but no benzene or hydrogen sulfide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could they run tests? I didn't give them permission to go into the mines. Wade retreats toward his shiny new Hummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you a question, you greedy son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm greedy?! You're the one keeping us down so you can search for gold! Chris tries to go after Wade.       Sam holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take another step. Chris stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking his side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to keep the peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy!    Just like your father! Wade drives off in his humvee.       The crowd begins to disperse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Chris heads off to his truck. Sam watches him go. Her eyes drifting down his body. Ashley steps up beside her mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're not gay after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't take your eyes off his butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you learn that it's okay to talk to me like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Mom. He's hot for an old guy. I can admit it. Why can't you? Sam watches Chris get into his truck. He gives her one last look before pulling out. Sam smiles with her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vintage mining gear. Walls covered with sepia-tone photos chronicling the history of the McCormick mines. GLADYS LAUDERBACK (50s) sits at a desk. She blows smoke from her Kool into the breeze of an air conditioner. Ignoring the signs behind her head: "NO SMOKING!",

dialogues.speaker: "DANGER GAS
dialogues.text: As Chris enters, Gladys hides her lit cigarette in a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you pop him one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had it comin'. But Sam Palmer... That woman abuses her power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because she stopped you from givin' Wade another pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not proud of it. Chris goes to a table and a map of the mines that honeycomb beneath the town. Many of them are marked "explored." Many aren't. Chris checks another tunnel off the list. He sniffs the air and glares at Gladys. Smoke rises out of her desk drawer. Gladys yanks it open and puts out the flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were trying the patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. She raises her sleeve to reveal several nicotine patches. Chris exits through a door at the back of the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris enters the family living quarters. The furniture was new in 1947. He continues to the adjacent kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris takes a beer out of the fridge. Then he notices an odd CLICKING. He tracks the sound to a stove burner permanently on "light." Chris moves to a fuse box in the adjacent hallway. He removes the fuse for the stove. The SPARKING STOPS. Chris sits at the table and has a cooling sip of beer. Gladys enters with a stack of bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That burner's on the fritz again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh something's broken? What else is new? (lays bills on table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to pay these by the end of the month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at bills)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today... For a split second... I actually thought I had it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another vein of iron pyrite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Then a rat stole my lunch. I practically blew myself up trying to get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you like my bologna sandwiches. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should talk to Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, if he really does have a buyer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You of all people know how much my dad wanted to find that mother lode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy wanted to    get rich. I don't think he cared    how that happened. If he was     still alive, maybe he'd sell those    mines. Chris takes umbrage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And maybe you didn't know him so well after all. A tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right... I'm just worried about how we're going to pay these bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give up on me, Gladys. I promised him I'd find the gold. And I will. Gladys steels her fear, patting Chris on the hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The sun rises.     The town slowly comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Prosperity, Nevada. It's another beautiful day on the frontier. Locals prepare their stores for business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARLAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No charges have been filed in yesterday's fracas between Chris McCormick and Wade Hale. And we've got... Joshua turns the radio down. He holds a tape measure to a glass spider tank, recording the size of an unseen arac. JOSHUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exponential growth rate... That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me so horny.   Me love you long time. Joshua doesn't look back at the parrot sitting on its perch. JOSHUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet, bird! Charlie looks over at the tarantula tank. Watching curiously as the cloth cover moves slightly. As if one of the spiders is escaping. Charlie flies over to investigate. He lands on the counter and peers around the back of the tank. CHARLIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's in the wire!     Incoming! Something yanks the parrot O.S. JOSHUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop screwing around...! Joshua looks back in search of the parrot. He notices several feathers floating down to the floor. He heads over to investigate. Joshua pulls the blanket clear to reveal the top of the cage has been pushed aside. No sign of any tarantulas. Joshua checks the back side of the tank. JOSHUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you go? Consuela? She's nowhere to be seen. Joshua spots      something sticking out from under the table. Two      parrot feet. Joshua pulls Charlie out from under the     table. It's a horrible sight. The bird is wrapped in      spider webbin His body desiccated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie... Semper fidelis. Joshua sees Charlie is attached to a web. He tugs on the webline. Something tugs back. Joshua leans down to look under the table. His eyes go wide at what he sees. Then a shadow looms over his head. Joshua looks up and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMS and the sounds of BREAKING GLASS come from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ranch style.    Cop car in front.     Chris's pickup crui by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris drives past.    He catches sight of a figure in a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is brushing her teeth at the window as Chris drives by. They make eye contact. Chris moves on. Sam looks at herself in the mirror. Bathrobe. No makeup. Messy hair. Mouth full of toothpaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work it, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes out of the bathroom dressed in her uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours. Ashley and Mike exit their rooms. Mike is dressed for the day. Ashley in a robe. They race for the bathroom. Mike is first. Then Ashley hip-checks him out of the way, slamming the door in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your excuse!? Sam sticks her head out of a room at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still want a ride, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun. Mike heads down the hallway and out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley turns on the shower, drops her robe, and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley is surrounded by steam. She sings an edgy gangsta rap tune by NWA. Tres' bizarre, non? Shampoo lather cascades down her face. Her eyes close. She is oblivious to a small spider crossing a web in front of her. The spider gets clear as Ashley rinses off the soap. Ashley rubs conditioner into her hair. The lather builds. Covering her face. Forcing her eyes closed once more. The spider returns across its web right in front of her eyes. The water stops. Ashley reaches for the showerhead blindly knocking the spider off its web. She feels no water coming out, and fumbles for a washcloth. Reaching with eyes closed, she can't see the little spider has landed on top of the cloth. As Ashley retrieves it, the spider scurries onto its opposite side. Ashley wipes the soap off her face. The spider rides the washcloth and moves toward her hand. Before it can strike, Ashley gets her eyes clear and drops the cloth. The cloth lands on the floor atop the spider. As the beast stares out from under it, barefoot Ashley steps on the cloth. Crushing the spider without ever knowing it was there.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ashley turns her attention to the showerhead. She cranks the water handles, trying to get the water flowing again. The handles suddenly pop off. Dozens of tiny spiders pour from the holes onto the floor. Ashley shrieks in horror. Sam bursts into the bathroom and yanks open the shower door. She drags Ashley out and looks at all the little spiders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what? Ashley just screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAM of a SAWZALL. A house in the midst of remodeling. Sections of wall are exposed. Sheets cover furniture. HANK (30s) is the Bob Villa-poseur. A cat sits near an open section of wall. Watching something intently. The cat charges into the wall after unseen prey. EMMA (30s) comes downstairs wearing her bathrobe. She clutches her ears in pain, screaming for Hank to stop. He can't hear. She grabs his shoulder and he STOPS CUTTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need to do that as six in the morning!? Do you hate me that much!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to finish before I go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been saying that for six months!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't finish if you keep interrupting! Hanks RESTARTS the SAW as Emma staggers into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma makes herself a hangover helper. Egg, tabasco, lemon juice, and a shot of vodka. All of it goes into the BLENDER. She FIRES it UP. Competing with the noise of Hank's SAW. Then Emma notices a bowl of uneaten cat food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma comes back in and UNPLUGS the noisy SAW. HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're gonna keep pulling the plug... EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Zeke this morning? HANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was chasing something earlier. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he got into the wall again, it's your balls in the blender. They hear FAINT MEOWING. Hank traces the source.       It coming from behind a partially-dismantled wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Zeke.   Breakfast is ready. EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the tuna. Emma heads back into the kitchen. Hank listens at the wall. After a beat he hears the CAT RUSTLING around inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke? Emma re-enters with a can of tuna.       She hears ZEKE H EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with him? Hank shakes his head. The CAT noises become more aggressive. The panicked couple tries to follow the cat's progress. They tracks the sounds of BATTLE along the wall. The noises become FRANTIC. SCRABBLING CLAWS. HOWLS of KITTY pain. HANK & EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke!?   Zeke!    Zeke!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They follow the cat's frenzied movement up the wall, across the ceiling, and down the other wall. Hank hurries over. He can feel his cat thrashing maniacally on the other side. A FELINE SCREAM. And then deafening silence. Hank tears open the drywall, reaching for his cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got him by the tail. He withdraws all that remains of the Zeker... a bloody tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike hops off his bike before it stops moving. Letting it crash in the dirt. He enters the mall through glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike passes NORMAN (18), a janitor polishing the floors. Norman listens to LOUD DEATH ROCK TUNES on a Sony WALKMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conspiratorial)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, dude. Yeah. You. Mike comes over to this goatee'd rascal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna buy some smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pack of cigarettes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke to get high, not to die. My stuff is hydroponically grown in a top secret location. No artificial flavors. No preservatives. Just 110 percent homegrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's this secret location?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have a dime bag for you toot sweet. But if I tell you where exactly, I'd have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, you know my mom's the sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... Right on... (considers this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she get high? Mike walks away, deeper into the mall. A dozen stores line the hallway: Victoria's Secret, Electronic Boutique, Sport Chalet. Most of the stores are closed for good. A large atrium features a fountain and jungle gym. Skylights cover the ceiling. Mike enters the Home and Garden store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike goes up to the counter.          The CLERK snaps at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bug spray is on aisle five!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want mousetraps!?       Is that it?! Aisle five! Mike grabs some batteries and lays them on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.     I thought you wanted... An OLD LADY walks past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, young man. Where can I find the bug spray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aisle five! The Clerk grabs the PA's microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over PA speakers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All bug spray, rodent traps, ant poison and fly paper is on aisle five! He returns his attention to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be three fifty-two. Mike pays the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's aisle five? The annoyed Clerk points. Mike heads over. He sees the aisle is crowded with locals squabbling over the few remaining cans of Raid, Black Flag and Off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beverly uncoils a hose, cranks a spigot. She sprays her vegetable garden with water. After a beat, a solid object is coughed up through the hose. Beverly continues watering. Two more unidentified objects are spewed from the hose. She reacts by cranking the spigot on full. The water sprays harder. Then inexplicably stops. Beverly checks the spigot. She looks into the opening of the hose. Puts it to her ear and listens. Sniffs. Now she puts the end of the hose in her mouth and sucks deeply, trying to siphon away the blockage. Beverly removes the hose. A FAINT RUMBLING sound. She puts it back in her mouth and sucks. A solid object comes through the hose and into her mouth. Then another. And another. A dozen things pump through the hose and into her mouth. Beverly yanks it out. Water spews from her mouth and out of the hose. Apparently the blockage has cleared. Beverly falls to her knees. Hunching forward. She vomits forth a stomach full of water... and small spiders. Mouth agape. Eyes wide in horror. She watches them scurry into the garden. Beverly tries to scream... but can only retch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Palmer rides his bike through a puddle of water. He sees Beverly throwing up in her vegetable garden. Mike it thoroughly grossed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rides his bike into Joshua's front yard.    He dismounts before the BIKE stops. It CRASHES.     Mike hea inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stops short in the doorway. An off-hook TELEPHONE BEEPS incessantly. WIND MOANS through shattered windows. Furniture is tipped over. Mike moves through the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   Joshua? Charlie? The spider tanks are shattered. No trace of their occupants. Mike pulls out his Cassiopeia PDA and starts recording. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into PDA) Captain's log. Stardate... Stops recording, PLAYS it BACK, listens to HIS VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool! (records again) The house is deserted. No sign of Joshua Taft or his bird. The spider tanks are shattered. There is broken glass everywhere. Mike moves toward the back door of the cabin.    It swing open and shut in the WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike comes out and notices hundreds of coin-sized footprints. He follows these tracks to a cluster of wooden barricades labeled: "McCORMICK AND SONS MINING COMPANY." Mike peers toward a vertical mine shaft behind the barriers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into PDA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animal tracks. Definitely too big to be spiders. Could be rats. Mike slips past the barricades. Following the tracks to the edge of the abyss. He can't see anything. It's too dark. Mike turns away and returns to the yard.    Never realizing... Several feet down the shaft. Hidden under a rock... the shriveled and desiccated corpse of Joshua Taft. It hangs from the side of the shaft in thick sticky webbing. Grisly. Suddenly the corpse is tugged loose and dragged deeper into the shaft by some unseen creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris's pickup is parked outside another mine shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris works with   his pick-axe. He pauses, listening to DISTURBING NOISE   somewhere down the tunnel. A growl? A roar? Chris isn'   t so sure. And then a new sound... a SCREECHING. The    noise grows LOUDER. Something's coming Chris shines his light into the darkness. Trying to see what's causing the unsettling crescendo... Suddenly dozens of RATS burst from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris runs out the mouth of the tunnel. The rat stampede is on his tail. He leaps into the back of his pickup. The manic rodents continue off into the desert. Chris looks back toward the gaping mouth of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, the Pied Piper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rides his bike. Floyd the barber stands out front chatting with an elderly couple. They hold a dog's leash in their hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I haven't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rides on. He notices a guy taping a flyer to a lamp post. Mike glances over. It's a sign for a missing dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike arrives at the local police station. Several cars are parked out front. The door is ajar. Locals are crowded inside. Mike lets his bike crash as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is behind her desk.   The place is swarming with locals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!   Quiet please! The mob is not listening. BEVERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were clogging up my house! EMMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what killed Zeke! TRAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a good dog! He wouldn't just get up and go! Deputy Pete whistles at top volume.   Everybody shuts up. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had spiders at my house too.     We need an exterminator not a sheriff. TRAVIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Travis. We're gonna keep an eye out. But we're not gettin' anywhere like this. You should go back out there and look for your animals. If they haven't shown up by tonight. I'll call Fish and Game. Okay? Pete ushers the grumbling mob out of the office.   Mike avoids the crush and manages to stay inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Mom!   All Josh's spiders are gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this right now, Mike! Everyone's having pest problems!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Joshua is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's out looking for his spiders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm serious! You're not listening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike... I've got missing pets. Spiders in the plumbing. Rats and mice coming out of basements. And your sister's about to end up on a milk carton. I can't have you losing... The PHONE RINGS.     Sam answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Wade... wait a second... your ostriches? OFF Mike's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prosperity is clearly visible just a mile away. The police car drives down a long road lined with fences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade's new Hummer is in the driveway. A CATTLE DOG BARKS as Wade leads Sam and Mike around the side of the house. WADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Came out to feed my birds this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coyotes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no! The trio steps to the fence.    Only three mangy ostriche are there to greet them. WADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My flock had fifty birds! Where'd they go, dammit! Who the hell steals fifty birds that can't even fly!? SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this happened last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.   And we didn't hear a thing. Sam gestures toward the BARKING DOG. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a peep. Mike notices some ostrich feathers on the ground.     He heads over for a closer look. The DOG watches his progress.    BARKING excitedly. Sam talks to Wade. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the ostrich business? WADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so good lately. SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got that new Hummer. You must be makin' enough to pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it? I'll take you for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These birds are insured.   Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill my birds, Sam.      Is that what you think? Mike looks back to see his mom confronting Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the distance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... reject... absolutely not... Mike scrutinizes what appear to be more of those tracks that he found at Joshua's. But this time they are larger:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into PDA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've found more tracks.    Even larger now. Mike follows the trail toward another mine entrance. This one is plugged with concrete. The tracks don't go there. They stop at what appears to be a normal patch of ground. Several ostrich feathers are scattered nearby. Mike takes a closer    look. Something doesn't seem right An odd demarcation    in the soil. His fingers trace the edge of a thin film    of material. It is a lid of sorts. A sheath of sticky    webbing coated with dirt. Mike is able to lift it. Mike peers into a deep dark burrow three feet wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty feet down the shaft.     A shape moves.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: A MULTI-EYED SPIDER'S VIEW of Mike at the top of the burrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike squints into the burrow but can't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark shape inches up the burrow toward Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is oblivious as he peers into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARKING CATTLE DOG SNAPS its TETHER and charges Mike. Sam and Wade see this and run after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike doesn't see the dog.    He's too busy looking in the hole.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The kid is FRAMED IN the burrow opening just a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike senses something approaching in the darkness. Suddenly he's grabbed from behind. Sam drags him away as CLYDE the cattle dog continues BARKING. WADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clyde) Now you're on the job?! What the hell were you doin' last night?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mike.     Let's hit it. Sam leads her son toward the house.     Mike glances back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sam are in the cop car.     Wade is at Sam's window. WADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what happened to my birds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I find anything I'll let you know. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can fill out that insurance form. Sam drives down the driveway. Wade takes off his hat and wipes his brow. He watches Clyde run parallel to the accelerating police car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam eyes the road ahead.     Mike is lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a trapdoor spider's burrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joshua was feeding his spiders bugs from the creek. And they were getting bigger. Mike glances out the window at the dog running nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they didn't stop growing? What if they broke out of their tanks. Ate Joshua. And went into the mines? Sam looks at him like he's out of his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could be why the other species are coming out into the open. They're trying to get away from the giant spiders. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ecosystem is out of balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been overdosing your Ritalin? She checks him for a fever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLYDE runs   next to the car. Suddenly he disappears underground   with a YELP. Only still frame on a DVD player will   capture the trapdoor spider's lunge from a camouflaged   den. The dog's empty collar rolls to a stop in a cloud   of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike turns from his mother and looks out the window. is confused when he doesn't see any sign of the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I am losing it... He checks himself for a fever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dingy collection of buildings surrounded by dunes and rock. The structures have boarded windows. Graffiti on the walls. Teenagers hang out. Off-road motorcycles parked nearby. Bret Hale's monster truck does donuts in the parking lot. Ashley hangs out the passenger window shrieking with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret smokes a Phillies Blunt as he donuts his TRUCK. Ashley laughs hysterically. Bret steers them around to the back of the truck stop. He SKIDS to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woo-hoo! Bret offers his stogie.    Ashley refuses.     Bret puffs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you had enough of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such thing.     Norman's bud is da'kine. He coughs and they both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I medal at the X-Games, Honda will give me full sponsorship. Then I'll take you with me on the Supercross tour. Ashley is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still thinking about going away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I want to do something with my life, Bret. Help people. Maybe med school is still an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you keep hanging out with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mom. They kiss. Things head toward a serious        level of " down." Bret slides his hand up Ashley's        shirt. Ash gets into it. But then Bret slides his        hand toward buttons of her 501s. Ashley removes his        hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down... Bret persists.       Ashley climbs off of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you loved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's the problem? You want to leave town. You don't want to make out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to lose my virginity in the front seat of a monster truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say so? We can go outside. I've got a blanket in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I guess... I'm just not ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tammy and Larry do it every night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then call them! Have a menage a trois!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on,   Ashley. Mommy's not around.    You don't have to play the good   girl. Let Daddy give you what you   really want. Bret goes after her once more.      Ashley's not into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Bret... Please don't... But Bret won't listen. Ashley isn't strong enough to fight him. She reaches into her purse and pulls out her stun gun. She rams it up in Bret's crotch and pulls the trigger. Bret howls like a baboon in a wood chipper. He spasmodically jerks off of Ashley and tumbles out the driver's side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret twitches on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My balls? Ahh! My balls! (looks down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pissed myself?! Damn, bee-otch!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ashley watches from the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to back off! Ashley closes the door of the truck and rolls up the windows. Bret is dazed as he gets to his feet. Then his eyes rack-focus to a nearby dune. A Rottweiler-sized jumping spider stands atop it. Two large eyes surrounded by six smaller orbs. Orange and black designs on its abdomen. Wiry hair. Dagger-sized fangs. Bret can't quite believe what he sees. Ashley STARTS the TRUCK.      This snaps Bret back to reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, Bret. I'm going home. Bret sees the spider leisurely coming down off the dune. He runs over to the door of the pickup and tries to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!   Open the door!     I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe my mom was right about you. Do you know how embarrassing that is? Ashley starts to pull away.         Bret keeps banging on glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, baby!      I love you! I want to marry you!      Have my children! Please! Ashley flips him the bird and BURNS RUBBER. As the truck moves out of the way, Bret finds himself staring at several more jumping spiders that are methodically approaching. Bret sprints around to the other side of the truck stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret runs from behind the building.    Larry Witzer and a bunch of other kids see him coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, did you piss in your pants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha!   Bret pissed his pants! All the kids start laughing and pointing at Bret.      No of them see the approaching jumping spiders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only one coming is you, dude. Larry and Randy high-five. A jumping spider lands on Randy's back, piercing him with its fangs, throwing him to the ground. Randy screams. The kids have a front-row seat as the spider's pincers mash their buddy into an edible pulp. Bret leaps onto his MOTORCYCLE and FIRES it UP. Several more jumping spiders bound across the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ride! The kids scramble, leaping onto their bikes. One rider is picked off by a spider. The others kick up rooster tails as they accelerate away. The spiders chase them into the dunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wasteland on the outskirts of town. The sandy waves are "surfed" by the noisy MOTORCYCLES. The jumping spiders keep after them, leaping a dozen feet in a single bound. A biker is ripped off a motorcycle.     The BIKE CRASHES. Larry ends up with a jumper on his bike. Another biker tries to kick it off, managing to knock the critter into the motorcycle's spokes. The spider gets munched. But then the courageous biker crashes and is set upon by a hungry jumper. Larry continues riding. But a spider lands on his back and sinks fangs into his spine. Larry yells bloody murder.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bret sees Larry go down in a cloud of gore and sand. Bret is the only human left. A jumper comes after him in mid-air. Bret does an X-Games style rocket air, kicking backward with booted legs. He knocks the spider away and keeps on riding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three familiar trucks cruise down the highway.     This t they are devoid of any toxic waste cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pig Pen stares fixedly at the endless road ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will live every moment of my life as if it were my last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will live every moment of my life as if it were my last. Suddenly Bret Hale wheelies across the road. A jumping spider explodes against the windshield. Spider guts splatter everywhere. Pig Pen screams as he JAMS on the BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRUCK jack-knifes into a line of telephone poles. Knocking them over and rolling multiple times before EXPLODING. Several jumping spiders are caught in the blast. Bret Hale rides on with several more jumpers behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black and white classic: Tarantula, plays over an old TV and VCR. Mike is at his computer, downloading a spider encyclopedia into his PDA. A message flashes across the screen: CONNECTION LOST. Mike picks up the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   Hello? The line is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bret rides into a dead-end canyon with the spiders very close behind. Bret steers for the mouth of a hillside mine shaft.

dialogues.speaker: INT HORIZONTAL MINE SHAFT
dialogues.text: Bret speeds inside. He looks over his shoulder to check for his pursuers, they're gone. Bret looks relieved. He faces forward as... whack! A support beam knocks him from his bike. The bike continues on into the tunnel alone. From the sound of things it travels pretty far before crashing. Bret lies on the ground as dust settles onto his face. He looks up at a support beam which begins to crack. Bret moves clear just as the ceiling caves in, sealing him in the mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several locals put up more signs for missing pets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlan is kibitzing with Travis. Pete and Emma console each other over dessert. Wade sits alone at a table for two. The attractive WAITRESS on roller-skates give him a fresh beer. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phones went down for some reason. Maybe that's why Bret didn't call. Did you want to go ahead and order? WADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the usual. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One ostrich steak, comin' up. Wade reacts glumly to the word "ostrich."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys smokes as she puts together the fixings for a large meal. She has a cookbook out. Pots and pans. Chris enters. Gladys quickly drops her cigarette in the disposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need some rat traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to surprise you with a special dinner. Turkey De La Gladys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have mine without Nicotine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as good that way. Chris goes through a nearby door to the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris comes downstairs. He rummages through some junk. comes up with several rat traps. He turns around to discover an odd hole in the wall. He ventures over for a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rats... Chris leans into the hole, his jacket restricts his entry. Chris pulls out of the hole, standing to reveal a large male tarantula on his back. Chris is oblivious as he takes off his jacket. The coat lands in a heap atop the spider. Chris gets back down and places one of the rat traps in the hole. He doesn't notice the jacket moving behind him. Chris backs out of the hole. He picks up his jacket. The spider is gone. He grabs his traps and heads upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris passes through the kitchen.    He eyes Gladys waril CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been smoking? GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Smoke pours out of her nostrils. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys... GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to work. I'll see you tonight. Chris starts out. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam called for you. Chris hesitates. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants you to come by the station. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She really has it in for me. GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? GLADYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two should just sleep together and get it over with. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Sam... Hook up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be older than electricity, but I used to be a nice-looking piece of tail. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding. I got more action than those chicks on VIP. So when I tell you Sam thinks your butt is U.S.D.A. choice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where I throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you don't think she's a fox. Chris mulls this over.   Testing his own feelings. He opens his mouth to ask another question. And then heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you for dinner. Gladys doesn't notice the basement DOOR CREAK open slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is on the phone at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet. I'm sorry.     We're still trying to get... Chris enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me call you back. (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been one crazy day. We've got missing pets, dead ostriches. God only knows what's next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about yesterday. Wade is... He knows how to push my buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to ask you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a date? Sam freezes for a second.     Chris laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding.   What did you want to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you noticed anything strange in the mines?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Define strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had spiders in my house. Hector had roaches in his basement. Some mice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about stampeding rats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were they running away from something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could have been. Never saw them do that before. I guess it qualifies as strange. Sam thinks this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... Do you want to go out sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me out on a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you're going to say yes. Sam smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement door is wide open. Gladys mixes food in a bowl. A cigarette with a massive ash hangs off her lip. A male tarantula moves across the ceiling. The creature is the size of a pit bull. Two quivering palps flank dart-sized fangs. Multiple eyes the size of quarters. Hair all over.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gladys is oblivious to the ominous threat above her. As she works, the spider shadows her. Every time the spider is about to strike, she goes another direction to get spices, utensils, a pan. Gladys places her bowl on the stove. Suddenly the tarantula drops onto the stove right in front of her. Gladys shrieks. The tarantula lashes out at her. Gladys grabs a frying pan and smashes it across the face as she stumbles backward. The spider reels, striking the burner knobs, turning on the gas. Gladys registers the sound of ESCAPING GAS. She looks back toward the fuse box and makes a run for it. As she goes, the tarantula fires a webline at her. Gladys gets the fuse off the top of the fuse box, but the webline prevents her from slotting it home. Gladys strains with all    her might, finally slots the fuse. She turns toward     the kitchen just in time to se the broken burner spark    to life. The gas ignites. The tarantula is engulfed in    flame. Gladys is knocked down by the blast. She lies on her back when a second male tarantula nails her with a webline. Gladys screams as she's dragged across the floor toward the basement door. The fire grows more intense, spreading quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's a 'No.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kids are the world to me, Chris. When their dad left... it really took a toll. On all of us. I can't go through that again. I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I understand... I don't know what I was thinking... (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys has some crazy ideas. I'm gonna kill her. Deputy Pete throws open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The museum's on fire! OFF Chris's look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The museum burns. The volunteer fire department attacks the conflagration. All the locals are there to help. Sam's COP CAR SKIDS to a stop. Chris leaps out. Stares at the fire for a beat. And then he charges toward the inferno. Sam tackles him from behind. Pinning him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   Let me go! Gladys!   Let me go! The museum collapses.     Chris watches it burn to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is out. The once-proud building is now a smoldering pile of rubble. Locals stand in small groups. Chris wanders through the ruins as    firemen mop up. He picks something out of the char.     The map of the mines Almost completely burned. Soaked     with water. He stare at it for a heavy beat. All that     remains of his legac Sam steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she got out. Sam puts a comforting hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (devastated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was cooking. The stove was broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come home with me? We'll get you cleaned up. Chris hesitates for a moment. And then he lets the map fall. He walks out of the ruins with Sam.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mike stands off to the side. He spots something near the edge of the ruins. He goes over to pick it up. It's a piece of arachnid exoskeleton. A spider's leg. Big. Very big. Travis the fire chief warns him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from there, Mike! Mike hurries clear with his prize. He puts it on the ground, sketches the outline of a spider to fit the scale of the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy God... Mike looks around for his mom.         He sees her drivin in the cop car with Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!   Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hangs low in the sky.         Sam's cop car parks Bret's monster truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley watches TV. A doctor resuscitates a dying patient with CPR. The doctor counts as he pumps the man's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two... three... Ashley watches intently.       The patient is revived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helping people never gets old. Ashley hears KEYS in the front DOOR. She quickly switches channels to MTV. Sam enters with Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Bret here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why is his truck out front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?     What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Ashley starts crying. Sam goes to comfort her daughter. Chris stands by in shock. Watching, Upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened, alright! Ashley runs off to her room.       Sam follows. Chris stands alone for a beat. He walks to the kitchen and pulls a bottle of Vodka from the freezer. He puts the cold bottle against his head and neck. Trying to cool off. Mike bursts into the house carrying his piece of exoskeleton. He sees Chris opening the bottle of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spiders shed their skins when they grow. Chris looks at Mike for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like snakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys is dead. Chris drinks vodka straight from the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. That got Chris's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a tarantula's leg. Or it was. It's an exoskeleton, to be scientific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little large.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chris has another gulp of vodka as Mike holds up his Cassiopeia full of spider data. He shows Chris a video of a male tarantula mummifying its food. Chris watches in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! Male tarantulas wrap their prey in webbing. Tight like a mummy. The food stays alive so they can eat it later. Sam enters the room in time to overhear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, please.    Now isn't the time. Chris looks up at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep their food alive. Mike hands his mother the new piece of exoskeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spider's leg! Sam flinches, dropping the object to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's a piece of cactus. Look... It's covered with spines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are quills! Tarantulas can flick them at you like darts! Mike does an odd flicking motion.       Kind of like a do scratching a flea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giant tarantulas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarantulas! Wolfs! Trapdoors! Joshua had a ton of exotics!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there were giant spiders roaming the desert, don't you think somebody would've seen them by now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jumpers hunt in daylight. But not the others. They only come out when the sun goes down! The group looks to the window, the sun hangs low in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prosperity is bathed in sunset. The mine shaft entrances are clearly visible. Like black holes of malevolent promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage is cluttered. Old station wagon. Bikes. Skis. Sam leads Chris to a bag full of her ex-husband's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I should watch more 'Oprah.' It must be a textbook 'no-dad' kind of thing. Chris shifts awkwardly.     In shock.   Sad.   Sam holds flannel shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one looks kind of scratchy. Sam holds up a shirt that Chris approves of. He takes it and proceeds to take off his old soot-stained shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Jason cared about was getting out and starting over. I guess that included buying a new wardrobe. Sam turns to pass Chris a pair of Levis. He's buttoning up the new shirt. Chris takes the pants. He doesn't register Sam ogling his exposed chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladys thought I should sell... but you know... I never wanted to get rich. If it was about the money, I would have sold out to Wade a long time ago. Chris moves behind the car and takes off his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I just wanted to prove the gold was down there. That my family wasn't crazy to keep looking. Even after we'd lost so much. And now... she's gone, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what I'm trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't about spending the gold, it was about finding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.    That's exactly right. Sam glimpses Chris through car windows. The poor guy's struggling to pull on some 501s. Sam turns away, but catches sight of him in a propped-up glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me never to let you do my laundry. She turns, only to see him in a mirror. He steps out from behind the car. Sam stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A melancholy N'SYNC ballad plays over a BOOM BOX. Ashley sits on her bed with her back to the open window. The sun setting in the distance. She rips up the photographs of Bret.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ashley doesn't notice the Great Dane-sized spitting spider crawling in through her window. It is striped like a jungle predator. It comes all the way into the room and then lingers among Ashley's stuffed animal collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike checks the phone. Still dead. He types at his computer, entering the specification of the piece of exoskeleton. A digital representation of a spider grows on his monitor screen. Showing Mike exactly how big the spider would be after shedding this skin. Mike is distracted by the LOUD MUSIC coming from Ashley's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you turn that down?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing spider research! Ashley stops ripping. She goes to the pile of animals, oblivious to the spider. The beast doesn't move. Ashley grabs a pink teddy bear with a heart on its belly. She returns to bed and cuts the bear's heart out with scissors. The spitting spider sneaks up behind Ashley. As it moves, so does Ashley. She scoops up the torn photos and mutilated bear, dumping them in the trash. She turns around to find the giant spider on her bed. She freezes momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
